info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 2:11AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lake and northern Missoula Counties through 300 AM MDT... At 209 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pablo, or near Polson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Polson, Ronan, Pablo, Turtle Lake, Kerr, Allentown, Kicking Horse, Round Butte, Charlo and Fort Connah. This includes Highway 93 N between mile markers 37 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
